name: YouTube's 2011-2012 HTML 5 Player
description:
Brings you the 2011 player back, and one that LOOKS like it.

It goes well with this user-style: https://userstyles.org/styles/117321/youtube-progressbar-fix
additional_info:
The Very First Update: added a user-style that (almost) fixes the video player, in full-screen mode

The Second Update Coming Your Way: retooled full-screen mode

I don't have a name for this third Update: Uses the 2012-2015 player as a base, but modified to look more like the 2012 version of the 2011 player, and made almost accurate to the original (though it hides the forward and previous buttons... I think)

This Update Should've Come Sooner: Fixes and additions that I'm not gonna list

Well Great: Made the progress bar centered until further notice

I should really stop "Typing Like This": Progress Bar fixed... for now.

The last update no longer applies: rolled back to the previous version for the time being

Let's hope that this fix works: Problem has been fixed, however, You Mileage May Vary, due to it being done on a 1366x768 display

Better late than never?: Fixed a problem generated by an update of the HTML5 Player... from last year...

One more update before I let you fork it: Fixed the settings box and right click menu (to the best of my abilities at least). If full screen looked off prior, then this update will fix it

discussions.name: can you fix the progress bar again, and fix this new progress bar feature too.
Really good, but the red bar doesn't go all the way across the video.
